subject: US History
metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: FA Understand 08 01

config.question: Which of the following was probably the greatest source of strong divisions among the peoples of the United States during the early nineteenth century?

choices.content: industrialization of certain parts of the United States
loyalty toward the royal family of England

answer_3.response: Consider This: The three-fifths rule gave southern states a disproportionately large voice in the House. Several times during the first 15 years of the nineteenth century, conspirators advocated secession. Though the schemes failed, they revealed powerful sectional loyalties that threatened national unity. See L.O. 8.1 How did the Republic’s growth shape the market economy and relations with Native Americans?
